name: Andrea H. Brand
title: Chair Department of Cell Biology and Director Regenerative Medicine Institute
summary: Neural stem cells in the adult brain exist primarily in a quiescent state but can be reactivated in response to changing physiological conditions.

name: Catherine Pei-ju Lu
title: Assistant Professor
summary: My lab aims to build a comprehensive framework for understanding stem cell biology of the skin, from development to disease.

name: Dimitris Placantonakis
title: Professor of Neurosurgery and Cell Biology
summary: glioblastoma; chromatin organization in human neural development; adhesions GPCR function and therapeutics

name: Elaine (Lyn) Wilson
title: Professor
summary: My major contributions have been to the field of tumor cell biology, and more recently to the relationship between normal prostate stem and prostate tumor cells.

name: esteban o mazzoni
title: professor
summary: We are passionate about understanding how cells acquire the functions required by a multicellular organism like the complex human body.

name: Hyung Don Ryoo
title: Professor
summary: My laboratory primarily uses Drosophila to investigate how cells mount stress-response signaling and how those mechanisms affect degenerative disease models.

name: Susan Smith
title: Professor
summary: My laboratory studies mechanisms of chromosome cohesion and segregation in human normal cells, stem cells, aging cells, and cancer cells.
